questions.question: A 50 kg object is lifted 2 m in 4 seconds. What is the power required?
questions.explanation: Work = mgh = 50 × 9.8 × 2 = 980 J. Power = Work/Time = 980/4 = 245 W.

questions.question: Select all options that apply: A person on a swing pumps to go higher.
questions.explanation: Pumping involves leaning back at lowest point to raise center of mass, and timing leg movements to add energy to the system.

questions.question: A roller coaster car has 80,000 J total energy. If it has 30,000 J kinetic energy, what is its potential energy?
questions.explanation: Total energy = KE + PE → 80,000 = 30,000 + PE → PE = 50,000 J.

questions.question: A 1,000 kg car moving at 15 m/s brakes to stop. What is the work done by brakes?
Select all options that apply: A yo-yo moves up and down its string. During descent:
questions.explanation: During descent: gravitational PE converts to both translational KE and rotational KE. String tension does work.

questions.question: A roller coaster car takes 2 seconds to go from 40m to 20m height. Average speed during this drop is:
questions.explanation: Vertical distance = 20m, time = 2s, average vertical speed = 20/2 = 10 m/s (actual speed is greater due to track shape).

questions.question: A roller coaster takes 2 seconds to drop from 40m to 20m height. During this drop:
options: It gains speed and kinetic energy
It loses speed but gains potential energy
It loses both speed and energy
Its energy is completely lost to friction
questions.explanation: As the roller coaster drops, gravitational potential energy converts to kinetic energy, making it go faster.

questions.question: A spring with k=200 N/m is compressed 0.5 m. What energy is stored?
Select all options that apply: A person pushes a box up a frictionless ramp at constant speed.
questions.explanation: Constant speed means KE constant. Moving upward increases PE against gravity. Person does work on box.

questions.question: A 800 kg roller coaster car has 200,000 J total energy. Maximum possible height it can reach is:
questions.explanation: Maximum height when all energy is PE: mgh = 200,000 → h = 200,000/(800×9.8) = 25.5 m.

questions.question: A 1500 kg car accelerates from 0 to 27 m/s (approx. 60 mph). What is the minimum work the engine must do?
questions.explanation: Work = ΔKE = ½ × 1500 × (27)² = 750 × 729 = 546,750 J (ignoring friction and other losses).

questions.question: Select all options that apply: In a perfectly efficient system with no friction:
options: Some energy is lost as heat
Work input equals useful work output
questions.explanation: Perfect efficiency means no energy losses, mechanical energy conservation, and 100% energy transfer efficiency.

questions.question: A roller coaster car at 30 m height has 100,000 J potential energy. What is its mass?
A 0.5 kg ball is thrown vertically with 50 J kinetic energy. What maximum height will it reach?
questions.explanation: At max height, all KE converts to PE: 50 = 0.5 × 9.8 × h → h = 50/(4.9) = 10.2 m.

questions.question: Select all options that apply: In a roller coaster loop-the-loop:
options: Speed is minimum at the top
Normal force is maximum at the bottom
G-force is highest at the bottom
Mechanical energy decreases due to friction
Potential energy is maximum at the top of the loop
questions.explanation: Speed min at top, normal force max at bottom, g-force highest at bottom, friction causes energy loss, PE max at highest point.

questions.question: A 20 kg crate slides down a 5 m frictionless ramp inclined at 30°. What is its speed at the bottom?
questions.explanation: Height = 5 × sin(30°) = 2.5 m. PE lost = mgh = 20 × 9.8 × 2.5 = 490 J. KE gained = 490 J. ½ × 20 × v² = 490 → v = 7.0 m/s.

questions.question: A roller coaster car has 80,000 J at point A and 60,000 J at point B. The energy difference represents:
questions.explanation: Energy loss between points indicates work done against friction or other non-conservative forces.

questions.question: Select all options that apply: For a satellite in stable circular orbit:
questions.explanation: Circular orbit means constant altitude, speed, kinetic energy, potential energy, and total mechanical energy.

questions.question: A 100 W motor is 80% efficient. How much useful work can it do in 1 minute?
questions.explanation: Energy input = 100 W × 60 s = 6,000 J. Useful work = 80% of 6,000 = 4,800 J.

questions.question: A pendulum bob has maximum speed 4 m/s at lowest point. What is its maximum height above this point?
questions.explanation: KE at bottom converts to PE at top: ½mv² = mgh → h = v²/(2g) = 16/(19.6) = 0.82 m.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent understanding of complex energy transformations!
scoreMessages.70: Good grasp - review rollercoaster physics and energy conservation.
scoreMessages.50: Basic understanding - practice energy calculations in multi-stage systems.
scoreMessages.0: Review energy conservation principles and mechanical energy concepts.
